SYS.name: Boot2
SYS.danger: Boot2 is a critical part of the Wii boot sequence. The only safe way to mess with boot2 is to install BootMii if possible.

SYS.name: System Menu
SYS.danger: The System Menu is a critical part of the Wii boot sequence, and failure to install a proper WAD, failure to install its corresponding IOS module, and many other factors can cause a brick. The only safe way to mess with the System Menu is with BootMii boot2 installed.

SYS.name: MIOS
SYS.danger: MIOS is a required element in Gamecube gameplay. Without it, Gamecube games will not run. You can reinstall a good copy to restore Gamecube capabilities if this should occur.

SYS.name: BC
SYS.danger: BC plays a role in Gamecube functions. Removal or corruption of BC will result in no Gamecube support. This can be fixed with the installation of a proper BC.

IOS.name: IOS4
IOS.danger: This IOS is a stub, meaning it has no functionality besides simply existing. You will not be able to run any code from a stub IOS.

IOS.danger: This IOS is a stub, meaning it has no functionality besides simply existing. You will not be able to run any code from a stub IOS.

IOS.name: IOS30
IOS.danger: Version 2816 of this IOS a stub, meaning it has no functionality besides simply existing. You will not be able to run any code from a stub IOS. Do not install version 2816, as certain versions of the System Menu require it to function.

IOS.name: IOS40
IOS.danger: Version 3072 of this IOS a stub, meaning it has no functionality besides simply existing. You will not be able to run any code from a stub IOS. Do not install version 3072, as System Menu 3.3K requires it to function.

IOS.name: IOS50
IOS.danger: Version 5120 of this IOS a stub, meaning it has no functionality besides simply existing. You will not be able to run any code from a stub IOS. Do not install version 5120, as System Menu 3.4 requires it to function.

IOS.name: IOS52
IOS.danger: Version 5888 of this IOS a stub, meaning it has no functionality besides simply existing. You will not be able to run any code from a stub IOS. Do not install version 5888, as System Menu 3.5K requires it to function.

IOS.name: IOS60
IOS.danger: Version 6400 of this IOS a stub, meaning it has no functionality besides simply existing. You will not be able to run any code from a stub IOS. Do NOT install version 6400!! as System Menu 4.0 and 4.1 requires it to function. Version 6400 will DEFINITELY BRICK your wii of version 4.1 or below!!
